Articles.Content: There is a lot of variety as far as crazy spacecrafts go, but I wanna see yours. Post a pic down below so we can admire your awesome work.

Might as well start the thread by setting the bar low, so here's my slightly crazy 5th-generation SSTO lift rocket. It has an estimated lift capacity of 140 tons, or a little over 3 orange tanks (which it is seen lifting here). The mass is about 1500 tons on the pad:

(The first launch happened to occur at night, but hopefully the navlights are illuminating it enough)
Nothing too crazy, just a poor imitation of a certain battle station. Farthest outside the box I've tried to build

Well, I was going to put this in the 'What did you do today' thread... but I think it fits here so much better.

Today I added more boosters.

Still can't get the kerbapult to orbit. >.< I'm getting closer, though!

This is a ship i built for the challenge in my signature using every part for bonus points. Probably the craziest ship i've ever built. And P.S., the images for the first three posts aren't working

It surprisingly flew quite nicely like this

But needless to say it didn't make it too far...

Thats about how far it got

Still can't get the kerbapult to orbit. >.< I'm getting closer, though!

Dude that's quite a......nice spacecraft you have there!

Here's some of my favorites:

Le jousting stallion.

My first (and only) attempt at delivering supplies to my north pole base by plane. (The plan was to drop the cargo by parachutes during a low fly-by).

An ode to KSP aerodynamics (I actually managed to land it!).

Edited March 5, 2014 by astropapi1

Muahahahaha....

I don't have anything for you today, but I'mma have a video up by Friday that'll be crazy >;D

Yeah, I'm aware my image is broken xP I tried to fix it by uploading it again, and then trying a different format, but nothing worked. I think one of the ServImg servers is down. It's served me well for a long time though, so unless this starts happening a lot I'm just gonna roll with it.
Current project. Getting an Arkingthaad style Munar lander to work. With RSS + FAR.
This spacecraft sharing thread moved to the spacecraft sharing sub-forum. Carry on.

Current project. Getting an Arkingthaad style Munar lander to work. With RSS + FAR.

You are the only person I've ever seen that creates spacecrafts like that. how....just....how....
